Game Saviour (FULL VERSION)
========

The present game has the key elements of  
* Arcade games, 
* Racing games, 
* Strategy games and 

Preliminary Version
----

If you need the initial version of the game, grab it from [here](https://github.com/deveshz/GameSaviour-Preliminary)

Mission
----
Saviour has taken the responsibility of collecting the Millennium development goals defined by the UN. 
He then uses these goals to eradicate the problems in  the inflicted areas of the planet.
During his quest he can also collect global  partnership goal ([MDG8](http://www.un.org/millenniumgoals/)) which will give another chance to play, as the people  throughout the world are now helping him.  
As the saying goes, “We should learn from our past, work in present and hence  brighten up our future", we have also tried to do the same. 
The MDG goals that are to be collected are spread in countries which have done  an overwhelming job in achieving the goal, as per the Success Stories provided by  UN. 
This is a tribute to those countries which have outdone others in achieving  the goals so far.   

Files
----

* **Assets** folder contain Spritesheets and other important reusable .PSD files

* **Code** contain the whole source files of the game

* **Readme** contains the complete instruction to play the game

* **Summary** let you know the idea behind the game

* **Screenshots** 

Code files
----
* **TrackManager.cs** - It handles the code files of the different tracks where the saviour drives

* **SpriteManager.cs**  - Handles all the Sprite properties

* **Game1.cs** - Main game file

* **Sprite.cs** - Main file which handles the properties of Sprite

* **AutomatedSprite.cs** - Inherited file whose motion is automated

* **EvadingSprite.cs** - Inherited file. For the power sprite which moves away from Saviour

* **ChasingSprite.cs** - Inherited file. For the enemy sprite which chases the Saviour

* **TitleMenu.cs** - Main Option Menu

* **HelpMenu.cs** - Help page (showcases use of font in XNA)

* **GoalBrick.cs** - Handle the Sprite sheet of goals

* **SaviourBrick.cs** - Handle the Sprite sheet of Saviours'

Technology
----

* Updated for  Microsoft XNA 4.0

* Language - C#

* Adobe Photoshop CS4

How to install
------------------
* Install Visual Studio 2010

* Install XNA 4.0 

* Open Zephyr.csproj / Zephyr.sln file with Visual Studio

* Hit Run

Game Play
------------------

* **Screen 1** : New Game | Help | Quit

* **Screen 2** : Select your Avatar 

* **Screen 3** : Try for a Goal and Championship Mode

* **Screen 4**: You are saviour. Control the car with Arrow Keys and collect MDG Bricks to move ahead. Save yourself from Enemies flying towards you.

* **Screen 5**: Push the MDG blocks over the enemies and hide them all to move ahead. 

License
-------

Saviour by Team Zephyr (India).  It is free software, and may be redistributed under the terms specified in the MIT-LICENSE file.

One of the two teams from India at[ Microsoft Imagine Cup](http://imaginecup.com) 2009 (Poland)
